question.title: Resources$NotFoundException when using Color.RED in getResources().getColor() inside Fragment
question.body:
I'm making an Android app in Android Studio and crashed when showing a red colored background dynamically inside a Fragment.

TextView feedback = new TextView(getContext());
feedback.setText("Correct Answer: " + correctAnswer);
feedback.setTextSize(24f);
feedback.setTypeface(lilitaFont);
feedback.setTextColor(Color.WHITE);
feedback.setBackground(getRoundedDrawable(Color.RED)); // This line causes a crash

And here's the getRoundedDrawable() function:

private GradientDrawable getRoundedDrawable(int colorResId) {
    GradientDrawable drawable = new GradientDrawable();
    drawable.setColor(getResources().getColor(colorResId));
    drawable.setCornerRadius(24 * getResources().getDisplayMetrics().density);
    return drawable;
}

Outputs:

android.content.res.Resources$NotFoundException: Resource ID #0xffff0000
    at android.content.res.ResourcesImpl.getValue(ResourcesImpl.java:299)
    at android.content.res.Resources.getColor(Resources.java:1104)
    ...

How do I use Color.RED (or any direct color int) with setColor() or getResources().getColor()? Should I change the method?

answers.body:
Try Changing the method to accept a color int, not a resource ID

private GradientDrawable getRoundedDrawable(int color) {
    GradientDrawable drawable = new GradientDrawable();
    drawable.setColor(color); // <= This Accepts both Color.RED or getColor(...)
    drawable.setCornerRadius(24 * getResources().getDisplayMetrics().density);
    return drawable;
}

Color.RED is not a resource id its an integer that represents the color red so when you try to do

getResources().getColor(colorResId)

it is trying to find an app resource that does not exist hence the Resources$NotFoundException

Instead it should just be drawable.setColor(Color.RED)
